These seeds produce 99% female cannabis plants. Take advantage of our many years of experience and the quality standards inherited directly from the famous DINAFEM seed bank, to buy collector's seeds of the highest quality.

Want to grow cannabis but not sure which direction to take? SILENT SEEDS feminised seeds could be your answer. Designed to produce 99% female plants, they'reideal for saving space and effort in cultivation. Whether you're growing outdoors, indoors or under artificial light, feminised cannabis seeds offer unbeatable benefits. Get ready to harvest the highest-quality resin buds that growers crave.

Understanding the concept of feminised seeds

SILENT SEEDS feminised seeds represent a major breakthrough in the world of cannabis cultivation. These cannabis seeds have been genetically modified to almost totally eliminate the possibility of producing male plants. In fact, only 1 feminised seed in 1000 will produce a male plant.

These seeds guarantee the production of female plants, which are prized for their high THC content. They are the product of various processes, such as rodisation or the use of colloidal silver, designed to force a female plant to produce male flowers.

Feminised seeds offer a number of advantages for growers. Their use saves space and effort, as well as time and nutrients, since there is no need to eliminate the male plants that could pollinate the females, thereby reducing the production of resin heads.

The process of feminising cannabis seeds

Feminisation of cannabis seeds is a process aimed at forcing a female plant to produce pollen. This is usually done by inducing stress on the plant, for example by extending its flowering phase beyond the point of harvest. This pollen is then used to pollinate other female plants, resulting in seeds that will in turn produce female plants. Two methods are commonly used: lapping and colloidal silver.

  • Rodelisation is a natural method that involves leaving a female plant in the flowering phase beyond the harvesting point. This stresses the plant, which begins to produce pollen.
  • Colloidal silver is another, more technical method. It involves spraying a solution of colloidal silver onto a female plant, which is then forced to produce male flowers and pollen.

In both cases, the pollen produced is used to fertilise other female plants, resulting in feminised seeds.

Discover feminised seed varieties

Pack of feminised seeds: an economical solution

To maximise your harvests while minimising your expenditure, consider buying Silent Seeds feminised seed packs. These packs generally contain several varieties of seeds, giving you the chance to discover a range of flavours, effects and growing facilities. They're often available at a special price, so you can save money on buying seeds individually.

From packs from renowned cannabis seed banks such as Silent Seeds, Dinafem Seeds and LaMota Seeds, to cost-effective bulk seed packs, you'll find options to suit your needs and budget. Whether you're a novice or an experienced grower, you can benefit from the diversity and quality offered by these feminised seed packs.

Original Amnesia feminised seeds: a popular variety

Original Amnesia feminised seeds from Silent Seeds are particularly popular with many growers for their many benefits. Originating in the Netherlands, this strain is predominantly Sativa, giving it a stimulating, energising effect. Its genetic profile is a blend of Haze and Afghani, two undisputed benchmarks in the cannabis industry.

These cannabis seeds are renowned for their rapid growth and generous yields. Indeed, the Original Amnesia plant is known for its large size and dense, resinous buds. It also yields abundantly, which

Whether you're a beginner or an experienced grower, Silent Seeds offers options to suit your needs. You can choose from a wide range of top-quality feminised seeds to suit your growing preferences and goals.

It's worth noting that the seeds in this bank are available in packs of different quantities, to suit the needs of every grower.

Grow feminised cannabis seeds indoors or outdoors?

Indoor growing: advantages and disadvantages

Growing feminised seeds indoors offers a number of benefits, but also presents specific challenges.

One of the main advantages is total control over the growing environment. The grower can manage humidity, temperature, light and ventilation, optimising conditions for plant growth.

What's more, the risks associated with climatic hazards or pests are reduced, which can lead to more reliable, higher-quality production.

Finally, indoor cultivation means that plants can be grown all year round, regardless of the season.

However, it involves a higher initial investment (lighting equipment, ventilation, etc.) and higher energy consumption.

On the downside, the growing area is generally more limited than outdoors, which can restrict the number of plants grown.

Finally, growing indoors requires regular monitoring and constant maintenance of the equipment to ensure optimum growing conditions.

Growing outdoors: advantages and disadvantages

Growing feminised seeds outdoors offers a different experience, with its own benefits and challenges. One of the major advantages is access to a source of natural light, the most important element for the growth of cannabis plants. The plants also have more room to grow, often resulting in higher yields per plant. What's more, initial costs and maintenance are generally lower than indoors.

However, climatic conditions can be a challenge: extreme temperatures, excessive or insufficient rainfall can affect plant growth. The risk of pests and diseases is also higher outdoors. Finally, outdoor growing is subject to the seasons, which limits the growing period to certain months of the year.

  • Advantages :
    • Access to natural light
    • Larger growing space
    • Lower maintenance costs
  • Disadvantages:
    • Dependence on climatic conditions
    • Increased risk of pests and disease
    • Seasonal growing
  • It's crucial to take these factors into account and choose the option that best suits your needs and growing environment.

Les graines féminisées et le taux de THC

What is THC?

THC, or Tetrahydrocannabinol, is one of the main active compounds in cannabis. It is a cannabinoid responsible for the psychoactive effects associated with consumption of this plant.

In other words, it is THC that causes the 'high' or 'stoned' effect sought by some cannabis users.

THC levels can vary considerably from one variety of cannabis to another, ranging from negligible traces to over 30% in some very potent varieties.

In the context of feminised seeds, it is important to note that it is the female plants that produce the THC-rich flowers. As a result, feminised seeds are often preferred by growers who want to maximise THC production.

Feminised cannabis seeds with a low THC content: why choose them?

Opting for feminised seeds with a low THC content offers a number of specific advantages. These varieties are ideal for those looking to consume cannabis without experiencing overpowering psychoactive effects. They are also ideal for therapeutic users seeking the benefits of cannabinoids without the euphoric or 'high' sensation usually associated with THC. What's more, in some countries, cannabis legislation imposes a THC content limit for the legal cultivation of cannabis. Growing low-THC varieties therefore makes it possible to comply with these regulations while still enjoying the benefits of cannabis.

Feminised seeds and CBD

What is CBD?

CBD, or Cannabidiol, is another cannabinoid found in the cannabis plant. Unlike THC, it has no psychoactive effect, i.e. it does not produce a 'high'. CBD is best known for its therapeutic properties. It can help relieve symptoms such as anxiety, insomnia, pain and many others. Feminised cannabis seeds rich in CBD are therefore particularly interesting for people who want to enjoy the benefits of cannabis without experiencing any psychoactive effects.

High CBD content feminised seeds: what are they used for?

Feminised seeds with a high CBD content are often used for medicinal purposes. Thanks to their high CBD concentration, they can help relieve various symptoms, such as chronic pain, anxiety, insomnia or inflammation.

These seeds are also a good option for those who want to enjoy the benefits of cannabis without the psychoactive effects of THC. They are therefore perfectly suited to people looking for physical relaxation without mental alteration.

In addition, feminised seeds with a high CBD content can be used to produce CBD oils, tinctures or topicals. These products are highly prized for their therapeutic properties.

In short, feminised seeds with a high CBD content offer a wide range of uses:

  • Relief of various medical symptoms
  • Physical relaxation without psychoactive effects
  • Production of CBD products such as oils, tinctures or topicals, or even edibles such as chewing gum, also known as 'gummies', which belong to the 'edibles' category (cannabis edibles or CBD hemp edibles).

Where can I buy quality feminised cannabis seeds?

You can buy quality feminised seeds online or in specialist shops. Seed banks such as Silent Seeds are particularly recommended for their wide variety of seeds and guaranteed genetic quality. Sites such as Silent Seeds, LaMota Seeds and Dinafem Seeds offer a wide choice of high-quality feminised seeds, all selected for their ability to produce top-quality cannabis plants. These sites offer a wide variety of seeds from European and American banks.

  • Silent Seeds
  • LaMota Seeds
  • Dinafem Seeds

Remember, to guarantee the authenticity of your seeds, always choose reputable sellers and avoid overly tempting offers that could conceal counterfeits.

What are feminised seeds?

Feminised seeds are cannabis seeds that produce almost exclusively female plants. They are the result of a feminisation process, which eliminates the possibility of producing male plants. These seeds are essentially cannabis seeds with exclusively female (XX) chromosomes, guaranteeing almost 100% production of female cannabis plants.

Unlike regular seeds, feminised seeds do not arise naturally. They are the product of specific agronomic techniques designed to maximise the production of female plants, which are the plants that produce flowers rich in cannabinoids, such as THC and CBD, as well as terpenoids and flavonoids.

It should be noted that feminised seeds are not really females, hence the importance of calling them 'feminised'. In fact, some of them can sometimes produce male plants or hermaphrodite plants, if the breeding work has not been carried out properly beforehand. You need a sound knowledge of cannabis genetics and of the genetic compatibility of the many hybrids, cultivars, polyhybrids and landrace varieties that exist around the world.

How can you tell if a seed is female?

To determine whether a seed is female, you need to observe its development. Unfortunately, it is not possible to distinguish the sex of a seed before germination. Once the seed has germinated and the plant is growing, signs may appear to determine its sex:

  • Male plants: they develop pollen sacs at the base of their leaves. These sacs are small, round and grouped in clusters.
  • Female plants: they produce pre-flowers that look like small white hairs (pistils) emerging from a small bulbous structure in the leaf axils.

It's vital to identify the sex of your plants as early as possible to avoid pollination and maximise the production of resin heads.

When to plant feminised seed?

To determine the best time to plant your feminised cannabis seeds, several factors need to be taken into account. The time of year is essential, especially for outdoor cultivation. Early spring, when daylight hours begin to increase, is generally considered the ideal time. This is when the soil begins to warm up, favouring successful germination.

However, the local climate also plays a crucial role. In regions with mild winters, planting can start earlier. In colder areas, it may be necessary to wait until the risk of frost has passed.

For indoor growing, the planting period can be more flexible, but it's always best to start germination when light and temperature conditions can be optimally controlled.

It's also important to take into account the specific flowering time for each variety. Some feminised varieties have shorter flowering times, which can allow several growing cycles in a year. Others have longer flowering times and may require more careful planning to ensure a successful harvest.

What's the difference between autoflowering and feminized?

Autoflowering and feminised seeds have distinct characteristics that influence the way they are grown and their yield.

Autoflowering seeds, as the name suggests, flower automatically after a defined growth period, without being dependent on the light cycle. They are generally smaller and have a faster growth period, which can be advantageous in limited spaces or for short-cycle crops.

Feminised seeds, on the other hand, are genetically manipulated to produce exclusively female plants. Their flowering is triggered by the light cycle and their growing season is more flexible. They often produce higher yields of resin and flowers.

Feminised seeds or autoflowering?

Feminised and autoflowering seeds offer distinct advantages depending on your growing project. Autoflowering seeds are attractive for their simplicity: they do not require a change in light cycle to trigger flowering and have a shorter life cycle, ideal for a quick harvest or less clement climatic conditions.

In comparison, feminised seeds require precise light management (photoperiod) to go from the growth phase to flowering. But they have the advantage of producing plants that are generally larger, and therefore a potentially more abundant harvest of resinous buds.

So it's essential to define your needs and constraints carefully before making your choice.

Feminised or regular seeds?

To choose between feminised and regular seeds, it is essential to understand the main differences between these two types.

Regular seeds are natural, produced by pollination between a male and a female plant. They can give rise to male or female plants, in a generally balanced ratio. This can be a challenge for growers who have to eliminate male plants to avoid pollinating females.

Feminised seeds are the result of agronomic techniques aimed at obtaining only female plants. They are often favoured for their ease of cultivation and their productivity in producing resinous flowers. However, they can sometimes give rise to hermaphrodite plants, requiring vigilance on the part of the grower, particularly if they are subjected to a great deal of stress (exposure to excessively high temperatures, water stress, etc). For both domestic and professional growers, feminised seeds offer a number of advantages.

Regular seeds offer more genetic diversity, which can be useful for creating new varieties. On the other hand, they are more unpredictable in terms of the sex of the plants obtained. Feminised seeds, on the other hand, guarantee a predominantly female crop, but have less genetic diversity and are generally more expensive.

Finally, the choice between feminised and regular seeds will depend on your growing objectives, your level of experience and your budget.
